text: after three prison sentences a total of
11 years in jail the Malaysian
opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim has been
released on a royal pardon mr. anima

has just defeated the former ruling
party in Malaysia for the first time in
the country's history the shock election
victory followed a reconciliation
between mr. Anwar and his former
persecutor Mahathir Mohamad the veteran
Malaysian leader who is now the newly
elected prime minister at the age of 92
David campin Ali has this report which
contains some flashing images after a
week of extraordinary events in Malaysia
this was one of the most anticipated

a once unthinkable reconciliation

trumped-up charges of sodomy and given
an additional 9 year jail term
Anwar says he's now forgiven mr. mahir
and stressed he would give full support

for his part and dr. Maha Tia now in his
90s has promised to step aside for Anwar
Ibrahim to become Prime Minister within
two years how these two strong-willed
former rivals work together we'll both
fascinate Malaysians and to a large
extent dictate how well the political
transformation in their country proceeds
